chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: Z
x: Z

Goal:
y < 0 -> Z.add x y < x

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
ZMicromega.ZSORaddon = {| RingMicromega.SORrm := {| morph0 := eq_refl; morph1 := eq_refl; morph_add := fun x y : Z => eq_refl; morph_sub := fun x y : Z => eq_refl; morph_mul := fun x y : Z => eq_refl; morph_opp := fun x : Z => eq_refl; morph_eq := fun (x y : Z) (H : Zeq_bool x y = true) => Zeq_bool_eq x y H |}; RingMicromega.SORpower := {| rpow_pow_N := fun (r : Z) (n : N) => eq_refl |}; RingMicromega.SORcneqb_morph := fun x y : Z => Zeq_bool_neq x y; RingMicromega.SORcleb_morph := Zle_bool_imp_le |} : RingMicromega.SORaddon 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp eq Z.le 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp Zeq_bool Z.leb (fun x : Z => x) (fun x : N => x) (pow_N ...
pols_test1 : forall x y : Z, x < y -> x + x < y + x
Z.lt_stepl : forall x y z : Z, x < y -> x = z -> z < y
Z.divide = fun x y : Z => exists z : Z, y = z * x : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.leb = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Gt => false | _ => true end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments BinIntDef.Z.leb (_ _)%Z_scope
Zeq_bool = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.ltb = fun x y : Z => match x ?= y with | Lt => true | _ => false end : Z -> Z -> bool Arguments BinIntDef.Z.ltb (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.pow = fun x y : Z => match y with | 0 => 1 | Z.pos p => BinIntDef.Z.pow_pos x p | Z.neg _ => 0 end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pow (_ _)%Z_scope
Z2Pos.inj_add : forall x y : Z, 0 < x -> 0 < y -> Z.to_pos (x + y) = (Z.to_pos x + Z.to_pos y)%positive
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => y | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' + y') | Z.neg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0 => x | Z.pos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' + y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.lt = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) = Lt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.le = fun x y : Z => (x ?= y) <> Gt : Z -> Z -> Prop Arguments Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
ZMicromega.eval_pol = RingMicromega.eval_pol Z.add Z.mul (fun x : Z => x) : RingMicromega.PolEnv Z -> RingMicromega.PolC Z -> Z
BinIntDef.Z.compare = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => match y with | 0 => Eq | Z.pos _ => Lt | Z.neg _ => Gt end | Z.pos x' => match y with | Z.pos y' => (x' ?= y')%positive | _ => Gt end | Z.neg x' => match y with | Z.neg y' => CompOpp (x' ?= y')%positive | _ => Lt end end : Z -> Z -> comparison Arguments BinIntDef.Z.compare (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : Z => match x with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos x' => match y with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos y' => Z.pos (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.neg (x' * y') end | Z.neg x' => match y with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos y' => Z.neg (x' * y') | Z.neg y' => Z.pos (x' * y') end end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
Pos.lt = fun x y : positive => (x ?= y)%positive = Lt : positive -> positive -> Prop Arguments Pos.lt (_ _)%positive_scope
N.lt = fun x y : N => (x ?= y)%N = Lt : N -> N -> Prop Arguments N.lt (_ _)%N_scope
Pos.le = fun x y : positive => (x ?= y)%positive <> Gt : positive -> positive -> Prop Arguments Pos.le (_ _)%positive_scope
Z.leb_spec : forall x y : Z, BoolSpec (x <= y) (y < x) (x <=? y)
BinPosDef.Pos.add = fix add (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => match y with | (q~1)%positive => ((add_carry p q)~0)%positive | (q~0)%positive => ((add p q)~1)%positive | 1%positive => ((BinPosDef.Pos.succ p)~0)%positive end | (p~0)%positive => match y with | (q~1)%positive => ((add p q)~1)%positive | (q~0)%positive => ((add p q)~0)%positive | 1%positive => (p~1)%positive end | 1%positive => match y with | (q~1)%positive => ((BinPosDef.Pos.succ q)~0)%positive | (q~0)%positive => (q~1)%positive | 1%positive => 2%positive end end with add_carry (x y : positive) {struct x} : positive := match x with | (p~1)%positive => match y with | (q~1)%positive => ((...
BinIntDef.Z.pred = fun x : Z => x + -1 : Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pred _%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.succ = fun x : Z => x + 1 : Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.succ _%Z_scope
Zr_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list Z) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr Z * Ring_polynom.PExpr Z)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr Z), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp eq (IDphi (R:=Z)) Z.of_N Z.pow l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp (IDphi (R:=Z)) Z.of_N Z.pow l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval 0 1 Z.add Z.mul Z.sub Z.opp (IDphi (R:=Z)) Z.of_N Z.pow l pe2
BinIntDef.Z.opp = fun x : Z => match x with | 0 => 0 | Z.pos x0 => Z.neg x0 | Z.neg x0 => Z.pos x0 end : Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.opp _%Z_scope
Z.bi_induction : forall P : Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful Z.eq iff) P -> P 0 -> (forall x : Z, P x <-> P (Z.succ x)) -> forall z : Z, P z
Z.add_wd = Morphisms.reflexive_proper Z.add : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful Z.eq (Morphisms.respectful Z.eq Z.eq)) Z.add
Z.log2_up_wd = let H : Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq (Morphisms.respectful eq eq)) Z.compare := fun (x y : Z) (H : x = y) (x0 y0 : Z) (H0 : x0 = y0) => match Z.compare_spec x x0 in (CompareSpec _ _ _ c) return (c = (y ?= y0)) with | CompEq _ _ x1 => match Z.compare_spec y y0 in (CompareSpec _ _ _ c) return (x = x0 -> Eq = c) with | CompEq _ _ _ => fun _ : x = x0 => eq_refl | CompLt _ _ H1 => fun H2 : x = x0 => False_ind (Eq = Lt) ((fun H3 : x0 = y => (fun H4 : y = y0 => (fun H5 : y0 < y0 => Z.Private_OrderTac.Tac.lt_irrefl H5) (Z.Private_OrderTac.Tac.eq_lt (Z.Private_OrderTac.Tac.eq_sym H4) H1)) (Z.Private_OrderTac...
BinIntDef.Z.shiftr = fun a n : Z => BinIntDef.Z.shiftl a (- n) : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.shiftr (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.rem = fun a b : Z => snd (BinIntDef.Z.quotrem a b) : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.rem (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.quot = fun a b : Z => fst (BinIntDef.Z.quotrem a b) : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.quot (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.sub = fun m n : Z => m + - n : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.sub (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
BinIntDef.Z.modulo = fun a b : Z => let (_, r) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in r : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.modulo (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.div = fun a b : Z => let (q, _) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in q : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.div (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.max = fun n m : Z => match n ?= m with | Lt => m | _ => n end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.max (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.shiftl = fun a n : Z => match n with | 0 => a | Z.pos p => Pos.iter (BinIntDef.Z.mul 2) a p | Z.neg p => Pos.iter BinIntDef.Z.div2 a p end : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.shiftl (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.log2_up = fun a : Z => match 1 ?= a with | Lt => Z.succ (Z.log2 (Z.pred a)) | _ => 0 end : Z -> Z Arguments Z.log2_up _%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.log2 = fun z : Z => match z with | Z.pos (p~1)%positive | Z.pos (p~0)%positive => Z.pos (Pos.size p) | _ => 0 end : Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.log2 _%Z_scope
Z.lt_ind : forall A : Z -> Prop, Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful eq iff) A -> forall n : Z, A (Z.succ n) -> (forall m : Z, n < m -> A m -> A (Z.succ m)) -> forall m : Z, n < m -> A m
BinIntDef.Z.to_pos = fun z : Z => match z with | Z.pos p => p | _ => 1%positive end : Z -> positive Arguments BinIntDef.Z.to_pos _%Z_scope
